normalised: Automotive News: Understanding Recent Vehicle Launches

unnormalised: Recent weeks have seen a flurry of new vehicle launches across India, ranging from electric scooters to luxury SUVs. Dr. A.P.J. Abdul Kalam Technological University’s Automotive Engineering department highlights the importance of understanding the technological advancements behind these launches.
normalised: Recent weeks have seen a flurry of new vehicle launches across India, ranging from electric scooters to luxury S U Vs. Doctor A. P. J. Abdul Kalam Technological University’s Automotive Engineering department highlights the importance of understanding the technological advancements behind these launches.

unnormalised: For instance, Tata Motors recently unveiled the 'Panchavati' EV, boasting a range of 400 km and a quick charging time. Meanwhile, Mahindra introduced its new 'XUV900' with advanced driver-assistance systems (ADAS), improving safety standards.
normalised: For instance, Tata Motors recently unveiled the 'Panchavati' E V, boasting a range of four hundred kilometer and a quick charging time. Meanwhile, Mahindra introduced its new 'X U V nine hundred' with advanced driver-assistance systems (A D A S), improving safety standards.

unnormalised: Industry experts are closely watching the impact of these launches on market dynamics. The Rs. 10-15 lakh segment is particularly competitive, with manufacturers vying for market share with fuel-efficient and feature-rich vehicles. Many of the launched vehicles also showcase advancements in infotainment systems, providing seamless connectivity and a more engaging driving experience. Dealerships are expanding across Tier-II cities, with some showrooms now exceeding 5000 sq ft to accommodate increased demand and offer comprehensive service facilities. This surge reflects the growing automotive market in India, fueled by both technological progress and evolving consumer preferences.
